newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Atlas signs copper mine rehabilitation deal.
newsitem.headline: Atlas signs copper mine rehabilitation deal.

text.p: Atlas Consolidated Mining and Development Corp said on Wednesday a group of investors had agreed to study the possibility of rehabilitating and operating its copper mines in Cebu in the central Philipines.
In a notice to the Philippine Stock Exchange, Atlas said the investors were represented by Frank N. Lubbock. It did not give details of the group.
Atlas' copper operations in Cebu were shut down in 1994 after a massive mudflow affected its underground first level and second level mines.
The investors would go ahead with the rehabilitation after "satisfactory due diligence," Atlas said.

"It is a major component of the agreement that the benefits due to the former employees of Atlas be settled partially, upon signing of the agreement, and in full once the investors decide to proceed with the rehabilitation of the copper mine. The investors will also prepare a settlement plan to be offered to the creditors of Atlas," the Atlas statement said.
